result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornell White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to be assigned to the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
No contact with the victim, Billy T.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow the recommended treatment. Take any and all medications as prescribed.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Restitution is set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornell White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  02-19-2015            Initials:  AAC

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, straight time, with credit for 182 days time served.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Billy T.
* Take any and all medications as prescribed.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow the recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant is to be assigned to the mental health unit.
* Restitution is set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.
 
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarcertation Credit form.
Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Invoice dated: 05-30-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on 06-11-2014 in the amount of $1,062.50 to Dr. Lundbohm for services on 05/12, 05/20, 05/21/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Cornell White not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Parties are still under negotiations.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-25-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Return on Doctor's NGI Report.
The NGI report does NOT support the defendant's NGI plea.
No challenges to the NGI report.
Defense withdraws the NGI plea today.
Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 06-10-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
NGI DOCTOR'S REPORT as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Brooke Lundbohm; filed.
Report from Dr. Brooke E Lundbohm received and filed with court.
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court MODIFED the bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point with the same previous conditions and the following additional conditions:  Defendant to be assigned to the mental health unit.
for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for return on doctor's report.
The competency report concludes that the defendant is competent to proceed.
No challenges to the doctor's report.
Based upon the stipulation to the doctor's conclusion, Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and "reinstates" the proceedings today.
Court ORDERS the defendant to submit to a NGI evaluation.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect (NGI). 
 
Court addressed bail:  Bail is currently set at $10,000.00 cash.  Defense moves for modification of the bail to a reduced amount.  Statements made.  Court MODIFED the bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point with the same previous conditions and the following additional conditions:  Defendant to be assigned to the mental health unit.  

Case adjourned to 05-28-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Doctor's NGI Report.
Court CANCELLED the 05-06-2014 at 8:30 AM Return on Doctor's Report Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.
to Judge Donald; from DHS Court Liaison, Vicki Shequen, advising the Court that the 05-06-2014 date needs to be moved up due to the defendant is now determined to be competent - filed.

Based on the doctor's report finding the defendant is now competent, Clerk scheduled this matter within 15 days of said notice.  Case scheduled on 04-16-2014 at 1:30 PM for Return on Doctor's Report Hearing.  Clerk CANCELLED the 05-06-2014 at 8:30 AM hearing date.
as to the defendant prepared by psychiatrist, Dr. Mark Phelps.

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Return on Doctor's Report Hearing.
Atty. McCandless advised the Court that there is no conflict with her office, therefore, she is willing to continue to represent the defendant.
The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is NOT competent.
No challenges to the doctor's report.
Court finds that the defendant is not competent, but is likely to regain competence if treated.
Court SUSPENDS the proceedings today.
Court REMANDS defendant to be committed to the Department of Health Services for placement and treatment in the appropriate facility.
Court ORDERS that the defendant is treated with medications and if the defendant refuses the medications, Court authorizes DHS to administer medications over defendant's refusal.
Case adjourned to 05-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Doctor's Report.

FILED, signed Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).
for Treatment (Incompetency); signed and filed.
as to the defendant; prepared by psychologist, Dr. John Pankiewicz - filed.

Filed, Legal Notice file stamped 1/23/14.
css

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney John C Moore.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Attorney Moore informs the court that due to a conflict, the PD's office needs to reappoint an attorney for defendant. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court vacates adjourned Preliminary Hearing date.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cornell White in court, in custody.  Sara McNutt for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Clerk contacted Public Defenders Office and an attorney has not yet been appointed to represent defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BILLY T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cornell White in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Cornell White in custody.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
